Package com.foreach.across.core.support

Class InheritedAttributeValue<T>

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.core.support.InheritedAttributeValue<T>
public class InheritedAttributeValue<T> extends Object
Represents an attribute value in a ReadableAttributes hierarchy. Provides information about the existence of an attribute as well as the ancestor level at which the attribute was found.
Since:
3.1.1
Author:
Arne Vandamme
See Also:
  • AttributeOverridingSupport

      public boolean isLocalAttribute()
      Returns:
      true if the attribute is a local attribute (getAncestorLevel() returns 0)

    • isInheritedAttribute

      public boolean isInheritedAttribute()
      Returns:
      true if isLocalAttribute() is false

    • exists

      public boolean exists()
      Check if an attribute was registered. Note that an attribute can be registered with a null value in order to shadow a previously registered attribute. If so both isEmpty() and exists() will return true.
      Returns:
      true if the attribute was registered

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns:
      true if a value is set for the attribute
